channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Harris' campaign faces potential legal challenges. And, a new dinosaur discovery
item.description: Some Republicans are arguing that Vice President Harris' campaign will have some legal challenges when it comes to using Biden's campaign funds. And, a new dinosaur discovery uncovered in Utah.
item.content:encoded:
Some Republicans are arguing that Vice President Harris' campaign will have some legal challenges when it comes to using Biden's campaign funds. And, a new dinosaur discovery uncovered in Utah.

(Image credit: Erin Schaff)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Here's a question for you: Do animals lie?
item.description: A researcher shares examples of deception in the animal kingdom.
item.content:encoded: A researcher shares examples of deception in the animal kingdom.
item.dc:creator: Barry Gordemer

item.title: GOP warns of legal obstacles in the transition from Biden to Harris
item.description: As Vice President Kamala Harris begins campaigning, some Republicans warn of possible legal obstacles to her nomination when it comes to both campaign funding and state election laws.
item.content:encoded: As Vice President Kamala Harris begins campaigning, some Republicans warn of possible legal obstacles to her nomination when it comes to both campaign funding and state election laws.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: VP Harris quickly embraces her new role as a Democratic candidate for president
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with chair of the House Progressive Caucus, Democratic Rep. Pramila Jayapal of Washington, about Vice President Kamala Harris' prospects to unite the party.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with chair of the House Progressive Caucus, Democratic Rep. Pramila Jayapal of Washington, about Vice President Kamala Harris' prospects to unite the party.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Babies don’t come with instructions. But in Oregon, they now come with a nurse
item.description: A new state program offers any family with a new baby a no-cost visit at home with a trained nurse. It’s Oregon’s response to the country’s dismal infant and maternal mortality rates.
item.content:encoded:
A new state program offers any family with a new baby a no-cost visit at home with a trained nurse. It’s Oregon’s response to the country’s dismal infant and maternal mortality rates.

(Image credit: Cory Turner)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: The economic mind of JD Vance
item.description: The Republican vice presidential candidate represents a sharp break from the Republicanism of yesteryear.
item.content:encoded:
The Republican vice presidential candidate represents a sharp break from the Republicanism of yesteryear.

(Image credit: Bill Pugliano)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Astronomers are scrambling to save the world's most powerful X-ray space telescope
item.description: NASA is facing a tight budget and wants to wrap up the Chandra X-ray Observatory, but astronomers don't want to see the 25-year-old X-ray space telescope mission go.
item.content:encoded:
NASA is facing a tight budget and wants to wrap up the Chandra X-ray Observatory, but astronomers don't want to see the 25-year-old X-ray space telescope mission go.

(Image credit: NASA/SAO/CXC)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Death toll in southern Ethiopia mudslides rises to at least 157 as search continues
item.description: Young children and pregnant women were among the victims. At least five people have been pulled alive from the mud.
item.content:encoded:
Young children and pregnant women were among the victims. At least five people have been pulled alive from the mud.

(Image credit: Isayas Churga/Gofa Zone Government Communication Affairs Department)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Can Harris — or any other Democrat — access Biden campaign money?
item.description: Vice President Harris likely has a strong claim to the funds, but not all legal experts agree. Moreover, the Federal Election Commission works too slowly to make much of an impact on the race.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris likely has a strong claim to the funds, but not all legal experts agree. Moreover, the Federal Election Commission works too slowly to make much of an impact on the race.

(Image credit: Erin Schaff)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: When did humans get to South America? This giant shelled mammal fossil may hold clues
item.description: A fossil of an armadillo-like mammal appears to bear cut marks from butchering by humans, suggesting people were living in South America at least 20,000 years ago, even earlier than once thought.
item.content:encoded:
A fossil of an armadillo-like mammal appears to bear cut marks from butchering by humans, suggesting people were living in South America at least 20,000 years ago, even earlier than once thought.

(Image credit: Daniel Eskridge)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel
